direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods check for the presence of an attribute but return different types of data (boolean vs. string).
Both methods deal with attributes but 'eachAttr' returns a list of attribute values while 'attr' returns a single value.
Both methods interact with attributes, but 'removeAttr' removes the attribute while 'attr' retrieves it.
Both methods modify or retrieve class-related attributes, but 'addClass' adds a class while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve class-related attributes, but 'removeClass' removes a class while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve class-related attributes, but 'toggleClass' toggles a class while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods check for the presence of a class attribute but return different types of data (boolean vs. string).
Both methods retrieve values, but 'val' retrieves the form element's value while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods retrieve content, but 'text' retrieves the combined text of elements while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods retrieve content, but 'html' retrieves the combined inner HTML of elements while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods retrieve content, but 'outerHtml' retrieves the combined outer HTML of elements while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve element-related data, but 'tagName' modifies the tag name while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'html' sets the inner HTML while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'prepend' adds HTML to the start while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'append' adds HTML to the end while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'before' inserts HTML before the element while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'after' inserts HTML after the element while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'wrap' wraps HTML around the element while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'unwrap' removes the element but keeps its children while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'empty' removes all child nodes while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
Both methods modify or retrieve HTML content, but 'remove' removes the element from the DOM while 'attr' retrieves an attribute value.
